result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both PAC Cause Injury (2+) and OWI Cause Injury (2+). The defendant was found guilty of PAC Cause Injury (2+) and the other charge, OWI Cause Injury (2+) was dismissed by the court.

  • Thomas J Beson was found guilty of PAC Cause Injury (2+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all Court costs and surcharges out of bail that is on deposit.
Seek and maintain full time employment.

Provide a DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.   Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
Report on December 1, 2015 by 5:00 p.m.
Transfer to Marathon County.  No GPS monitoring.

WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Defendant Thomas J Beson in court with Attorney Richard Joseph Smith.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for Sentencing.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  AS TO COUNT #2:  Defendant ordered to serve TWELVE (12) months in the House of Correction STRAIGHT TIME with credit of THIRTEEN (13) days time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for TWO (2) years with the following conditions:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.
*Random urine screens.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Restitution set at ZERO.
*Defendant to serve FOURTY-FIVE (45) days in House of Correction with transfer to Marathon County.  Defendant is to have no GPS monitoring.  
*Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on December 1, 2015 by 5:00pm
*Defendant's operating privileges are suspended for TWO (2) years.
*Defendant must provide DNA sample and pay surchage; Defendant to pay court costs and surcharges.  Amounts are to be taken to pay costs and surcharges out of bail that is on deposit.

FILED, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
FILED, Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Thomas J Beson in court with attorney Richard Joseph Smith.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a plea hearing.  AS TO COUNT #1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  

Matter is set for sentencing on November 17, 2015 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.

Defendant Thomas J Beson in court with Attorney Richard Joseph Smith.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Pre-Trial Conference.  The defense requested that the defendant be monitored and drop random screens by Attic Correctional Services, Inc in Wausau, Wisconsin due to that is where the defendant lives.  No objection from the State.  The Attic Correctional Services can monitor the defendant, but they have to send in a report to the Court and to WCS.  The contact person at Attic Correctional Services is James Hoelter, (715) 848-3202 x211.

The October 14, 2015 jury trial date has been VACATED.  Matter is adjourned for a plea hearing on October 7, 2015 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
